title: Riak Recap for September 28 - October 02
description:
Posted on October 02, 2011

Evening, Morning, Afternoon to All -

For today’s Recap: new code, talks, slides, jobs, and more.

Enjoy.

Mark

Riak Recap for September 28 – October 2

  1. The slides from the Riak training that Ian Plosker and Sean Cribbs delivered last week are online.
    → Check them out here
  2. There was some great discussion on Hacker News following the official release of Riak 1.0.
    → Read and participate here
  3. The Riak Homebrew recipe was updated to 1.0. (Thanks, Bryce!)
    → Commit here on GitHub
  4. Justin Calleja wrote a blog post called “Erlang transport test drive” that demonstrates how to use David Dossot’s Erlang transport for Mule (using a Riak-backed demo app). (Thanks, Justin!)
    → Read here
  5. Basho is holding a webinar all about 1.0’s new query-related features and functionality.
    → Registration and details here
  6. For anyone in San Francisco: there will be Tech Talk this Wednesday at the Boundary offices. John M will be giving details on the Riak-backed app they have running at ShowYou (and the Scalang talk definitely won’t disappoint).
    → Seats are limited. Details here
  7. Kyle Kingsbury released new version of Risky.
    → Latest here
  8. A few great jobs to pass along:
    → Synacor is hiring a Web Software Architect in Buffalo, NY to work with Riak.
    → Root Labs, based in Oakland, is hiring a Lead Engineer with a good understanding of Riak and Redis.
